snippet: In part of Borneo, a parasite called Plasmodium knowlesi causes severe malaria three times as often as Plasmodium falciparum, which has long been considered the deadliest form of the disease, new research suggests.
abstract: Rare and virulent form of malaria caused by parasite Plasmodium knowlesi is becoming so common in Malaysia that it accounts for most hospitalizations there; deadly version of disease is commonly found in monkeys, but as loggers and palm oil producers have pushed deeper into Malaysia’s forests, more humans have been bitten by mosquitoes carrying it.
lead_paragraph: In part of Borneo, a parasite called Plasmodium knowlesi causes severe malaria three times as often as Plasmodium falciparum, which has long been considered the deadliest form of the disease, new research suggests.

headline.print_headline: A Rare Form of Malaria Is Spreading in Malaysia
headline.main: A Rare Form of Malaria Is Spreading in Malaysia
